page.title: 04HAVERTON TODAY
page.content: {Haverton Hill}is just a shell of the original community of glass and iron foundry workers who settled alongside {Port Clarence}and the river{Tees.} Polution in the 1960's resulted in the rehousing of the community to the nearby town of{Billingham.}Later the cement works,the sulphuric acid plant and the shipyard all closed down. The air is now clear but the people,the streets and the houses are gone. Only a very few struggle on like the local butcher,who commutes from Billingham,a green grocer using an empty betting shop and a garage doing M.O.T.tests.
